bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 49 (Friday, March 18, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. O'HALLERAN:H.R. 7168.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 18, section 8 of article 1 of the Constitution[Page H3854]

item.title: Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 258.

item.title: Protecting America's Wilderness and Public Lands Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act

This bill modifies the boundary of the Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument in Arizona to include approximately 97.71 acres of identified Forest Service land.

The bill transfers administrative jurisdiction over the Forest Service land from the Forest Service to the National Park Service (NPS).

The NPS shall administer the added land as part of the monument.

bill.title: Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act

item.title: Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act
Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act
To modify the boundary of the Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument in the State of Arizona, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
